titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Ministers' Club of St. Paul records 1893-1901
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Ministers' Club of St. Paul records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Ministers' Club of St. Paul was a group of clergymen who met regularly for mutual fellowship and to hear book reviews and addresses on a variety of topics. The Club was founded in 1893.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of semi-monthly meetings of the Presbyterian Ministers' Club of St. Paul, Minnesota, 1893-1901. Minutes record the club's routine business and include summaries of book reviews and addresses given before the club. The minutes also includes calendars of addresses and lists of members.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
